sentences: See on ainus väljapääs sellest hoonest.
Põgenemiseks oli vaja leida kiire väljapääsu.
context: The Estonian word 'väljapääsu' is the partitive case form of 'väljapääs', which means 'exit' or 'way out'. It's commonly used when referring to an exit point, escape route, or way to get out of a location. The partitive case (-u ending) indicates that we're talking about some or one of the exits, rather than specifying a particular exit.
